result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus D Hackett

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marcus D Hackett appeared by video.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Marcus D Hackett.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defense requests dates for final pretrial and jury trial be set.  Court sets the deadline of 1/24/2023 for filing of Jury Instructions, Motions in Limine, Witness lists and Change of Plea forms.  Court Orders State to provide crime lab report prior to final pretrial hearing.  Court ordered Defendant to appear in person for future court dates  Matter adjourned to Br. 9.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 3, 2023 at 10:00 am. Jury trial scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcus D Hackett in court.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Marcus D Hackett.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests adjourned Scheduling conference to allow time to review video discovery.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Marcus D Hackett in court with Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 02CF5060.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. Reagan. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 09.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marcus D Hackett in court, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marcus D Hackett in court, appear by video.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Remaining cash bail posted to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT LEVEL 2 for supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court.  
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Marcus D Hackett in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 5/9/22 @ 1:30p
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 5/9/22 @ 1:30p

Actual Date Bond Posted with the Sheriffs Department:
03/26/22.    22RM016780
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/9/2022 @ 1:30pm.
